definitions: To act as a neutralizing or counterbalancing force to something.
To improve the hardness and elasticity of (steel or other metal) by reheating and then cooling it.
To bring (something) to a less extreme or violent state; moderate.
To tune (a keyboard instrument) so as to make the intervals sound correct.
examples: His calm demeanor tempers her fiery personality.
The blacksmith tempers the blade in the oil.
She tempers her criticism with praise.
The technician tempers the piano before the concert.
